name: Hard Dog Show Lingo Quiz / Test | Dog Shows | 10 Questions

questions.text: Your friend exclaims, "My dog just went BOB over specials!" What in the heck is she talking about?
questions.correct: Her dog was chosen best of its breed over all the champion dogs
options: Her dog went bonkers over a special new food
Her dog went barking mad  (barking out brains) over a television special
Her dog jumped cleanly over a special jump on the agility course
questions.explanation:
Her dog was chosen best of its breed over all the champion dogs.

	BOB stands for "Best of Breed." Going Best of Breed over specials means that a non-champion dog beat out all of the dogs that were already champions to be chosen as the best representative of its breed.

questions.text: Your friend comments that a dog in the ring has a gay tail. What does this mean?
questions.correct: The tail is carried over the back
options: The tail has a white tip on the end
The dog is wagging its tail happily
questions.explanation:
The tail is carried over the back.

	Some breeds, like hounds, are supposed to have a gay tail, but other breeds, such as retrievers, are not. A line has stuck in my head that I am pretty sure was said by Pongo to Perdita in the book "101 Dalmatians"- "Let our hearts be gay but not our tails." Dodie Smith must have shown Dalmatians.

questions.text: You hear that a certain dog was "put up" at a show. What happened?
questions.correct: The judge chose the dog as a winner
options: The dog was placed on a grooming table
questions.explanation:
The judge chose the dog as a winner.

	A judge "puts up" a dog when he or she chooses that dog as a winner.

questions.text: The ringside observers note that your Weimaraner is "nicely stacked." What are they commenting on?
options: We can't specify it on a family site!
Your dog's likelihood to win its class
questions.explanation:
Your dog's stance.

	When your dog is "stacked," he or she is standing in the appropriate pose called for in the breed standard, so the judge can examine the dog's structure.

questions.text: Your dog show friend announces that her dog has finished. Is she happy about this?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	When a dog "finishes," it has acquired all the points necessary to finish its championship- it is now a champion dog!

options: A representative of a breed rescue organization
A sticky substance applied to a dog's paws to keep it from slipping in the ring
questions.explanation:
A type of show lead.

	Resco makes a wide variety of show leads that look like leather but aren't.

questions.text: Should you expect to see a stripper at a dog show?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	A stripper is a special kind of grooming blade used to pluck- or strip- hair from the coats of certain breeds, such as terriers.

questions.text: You hear that a certain poodle breeder is a BYB. Do most dog people want to be known as a BYB?
questions.explanation:
No.

	BYB stands for "Backyard Breeder"- someone who breeds dogs without responsibility or knowledge, without health tests, puppy tests, contracts, or other things that all responsible breeders should do.

questions.text: Which of the following breeds would be most likely to have a snood?
questions.explanation:
English springer spaniel.

	A snood is a tube of cloth that slips over the dog's head and covers the ears, keeping them out of water and food. Many dogs with long hair on their ears wear snoods between being groomed for a show and going in the ring.

questions.text: If you are going to a Specialty, what do you expect to see?
questions.correct: A show for only one breed
options: A show for only champion dogs (specials)
A show with special events only, like agility
A show where only professional handlers can show
questions.explanation:
A show for only one breed.

	Most breeds have yearly specialties, which usually include classes like agility and obedience in addition to the conformation show.
